english: beauty that sinks fish and makes birds fall

etymology.description: 沉鱼 (sink fish) + 落雁 (falling geese) = beauty so stunning that fish dive and geese drop.
etymology.interpretation: Hyperbolic praise for extraordinary feminine beauty; often paired with 闭月羞花 and linked to legendary beauties Xi Shi (沉鱼) and Wang Zhaojun (落雁).
etymology.simplification: 魚 → 鱼 in PRC simplification to reduce strokes; 沉 and 落雁 unchanged.

parts.english: sinking fish; to make fish dive (by stunning beauty)
falling wild geese; to make geese fall (by stunning beauty)

examples.chinese: 她的美貌可谓沉鱼落雁(她的美貌可謂沉魚落雁)。
examples.pinyin: Tā de měimào kěwèi chén yú luò yàn.
examples.english: Her beauty could be described as so stunning that fish sink and geese fall.

examples.chinese: 古人用沉鱼落雁来称颂绝色女子(古人用沉魚落雁來稱頌絕色女子)。
examples.pinyin: Gǔrén yòng chén yú luò yàn lái chēngsòng juésè nǚzǐ.
examples.english: The ancients used ‘chén yú luò yàn’ to praise women of peerless beauty.

examples.chinese: 这幅画把女子画得有沉鱼落雁之姿(這幅畫把女子畫得有沉魚落雁之姿)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè fú huà bǎ nǚzǐ huà de yǒu chén yú luò yàn zhī zī.
examples.english: This painting portrays the woman with beauty said to sink fish and fell geese.
